e4: While adopting a new policy with unbiased earnings might seem more honest, it would likely mislead investors who have come to expect an additional $0.50 adjustment, ultimately resulting in financial losses for some investors, especially those who don't account for the bias.
e5: An ethical reporting policy would prioritize transparency and accuracy, without intentionally misleading or deceiving investors. It should also consider the diverse needs of stakeholders, including both sophisticated and unsophisticated investors. In this context, I would view a policy as more ethical if it takes steps to educate investors about actual earnings and facilitates fair and informed decision-making, rather than capitalizing on existing biases or expectations.
e6: Yes. I would ask for more information about how the company plans to communicate changes in policy to investors, and whether steps will be taken to educate retail investors who may not adjust their expectations in time.
q9: Oumuamua, a cigar-shaped asteroid-like object discovered in 2017.
